topic.title: [search] End-to-end encryption project (chats, others...)
topic.body:
Hello,
Some body here work on a end-to-end encryption project ? Hosted on github, gitltab, or wathever.
I would like know (and learn) how it works with asymmetric encryption.
Thx.

1_1ChnrTG81t6NbinCLMuar7hSCMDypnK1Tt.body:
It's just for information/knowledge purpose, in fact I already search on github but I've not found really good content too learn from scratch.
But thank you and I will continue to search :)

@peeper of course I can find it.
ex : Readme of zeronet's mail project.
```
ZeroMail
End-to-end encrypted, P2P messaging site.
```
I need documentation, explanation of encryption algorithm etc etc... 
Because agree me it's poorly documented.

> [glightstar](#comment_12_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): ThunderWave's private chat has End2End-Encryption!
> (I'm the maker ;))
> 
> It uses the default crypto-function provided with the ZeroNet-API.
>
> PS.: ThunderWave uses both, ecies and aes for private chats.

Ho... How I missed this doc... Shame on me, thanks for the sharing. Now I should learn more about the implementation :)
